Description: Ostracon, large section (two fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery wine-jar, the exterior is covered with a thick cream-coloured slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text recording a quantity of vegetal matter (name before plant determinative largely lost), the piece is marked with a number of 'sample' holes.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III, pl.97, no.327.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393459) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393459)
